Package fr.sorbonne_u.components.interfaces

Interface TwoWayCI

  • All Superinterfaces:
    ComponentInterface, OfferedCI, Remote, RequiredCI
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    DataTwoWayCI, DataTwoWayConnectorI, TwoWayPortI<TWI>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractDataTwoWayConnector, AbstractDataTwoWayPort, AbstractTwoWayPort, DataTwoWayConnector
    public interface TwoWayCI
extends RequiredCI, OfferedCI
    The component interface TwoWayCI is meant to represent symmetric component interfaces connecting two components that can play both the role of clients and server towards each others.

    Description

    Basically, a two way interface can be seen as both a required and an offered interface. The symmetry in the definition eases the connection and the calls between the two components.

    Created on : 2012-01-23

    Author:
    Jacques Malenfant
